snippet: The law allowing doctors to prescribe life-ending drugs for terminally ill patients is expected to take effect sometime next year.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown signs right-to-die bill into law, allowing doctors to prescribe life-ending drugs to terminally ill patients; is fifth state to enact such a law; bill stipulates that patients must be terminally ill, mentally sound, and capable of administering medication themselves.

byline.original: By IAN LOVETT and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA
byline.contributor: Ian Lovett reported from Los Angeles, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.

lead_paragraph: The law allowing doctors to prescribe life-ending drugs for terminally ill patients is expected to take effect sometime next year.

headline.main: California Governor Signs Assisted Suicide Bill Into Law
headline.print_headline: Brown Signs ‘Right-to-Die’ Into Law in California
